description.narrative: Support for Indonesian Education Phase 2 initiative consists of three key elements: construction of junior secondary school infrastructure; development of district and school management capacity; and analytical support to Government of Indonesia (GoI) to assist policymaking. Under Phase 2: the 35 per cent junior secondary access gap will be narrowed to 5 per cent through a combination of GoI resources (20 per cent) and AusAID resources (10 per cent); children in 1000 communities will gain access to good quality junior secondary school facilities; community employment opportunities will be created for 50,000 people in 1000 communities through school construction; decentralised education service delivery will be strengthened; and sub-national government schools will have enhanced performance against minimum service standards related to access, professional development, and teacher management, as a result of management training programs delivered to at least 50,000 principals and district
